org.tal.redstonechips.circuit
Class Circuit

java.lang.Object
  org.tal.redstonechips.circuit.Circuit
Direct Known Subclasses:
BitSetCircuit
public abstract class Circuit
extends Object

Represents a RedstoneChips circuit.

Author:
Tal Eisenberg

Field Detail

redstoneChips

protected RedstoneChips redstoneChips
Reference to the core plugin instance.

args

public String[] args
Circuit sign arguments. Any word found on the circuit sign from line 2 onward.

inputs

public InputPin[] inputs
Ordered list of input pins.

outputs

public OutputPin[] outputs
Ordered list of output pins.

structure

public org.bukkit.Location[] structure
Contains the location of any block that is part of this circuit. When any block in this array is broken the circuit is destroyed. This includes the sign block, chip blocks, input blocks, output blocks and output lever blocks.

interfaceBlocks

public InterfaceBlock[] interfaceBlocks
Ordered list of interface blocks. Used for interaction points with the "physical" world.

activationBlock

public org.bukkit.Location activationBlock
The location of the sign block that was used to activate the circuit.

world

public org.bukkit.World world
Reference to the minecraft World this circuit was built in.

inputBits

protected BitSet7 inputBits
The current state of each input bit. Should be used only for monitoring. Do not change its value.

outputBits

protected BitSet7 outputBits
The current state of each output bit. Should be used only for monitoring. Do not change its value.

disabled

public boolean disabled
When set to true any input changes will be ignored.

id

public int id
The circuit id. Set by CircuitManager.

name

public String name
An optional circuit instance name.

circuitChunks

public ChunkLocation[] circuitChunks
Set to the chunk coordinates of the circuit's activation block

Constructor Detail

Circuit

public Circuit()
Method Detail

initCircuit

public final boolean initCircuit(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                                 RedstoneChips rc)
Initializes the circuit. Updates input pin values according to source blocks. Refreshes the output pins according to input states if the circuit is stateless.

Parameters:
sender - The sender that activated the circuit. Used for sending error or status messages after activation.
args - The sign arguments of this circuit. Stored in the args field.
Returns:
result of call to abstract Circuit.init() method.

stateChange

public void stateChange(int idx,
                        boolean newVal)
Called by the plugin whenever an input pin changes state. If the new state is different from the previous state stored in inputBits the inputBits value is updated and the inputChange(idx, newVal) method is called.

Parameters:
idx - The changed input pin index.
newVal - true if the current is greater than 0.

destroyCircuit

public void destroyCircuit(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender destroyer)
Resets outputs, calls circuitShutdown() and circuitDestroyed().

shutdownCircuit

public void shutdownCircuit()
Shuts down the circuit and any Wireless classes associated with it and informs all CircuitListeners. Additional shut down code can be inserted by overriding Circuit.circuitShutdown().

inputChange

public abstract void inputChange(int inIdx,
                                 boolean state)
Called when an input pin state is changed.

Parameters:
inIdx - index of changed input pin.
state - The new state of the input pin.

init

protected abstract boolean init(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                                String[] args)
Called after the chip is activated by a user or after the chip is loaded from file.

Parameters:
sender - The command sender that activated the chip, or null if called on startup.
args - Any words on the sign after the circuit type.
Returns:
true if the init was successful, false if an error occurred.

getInternalState

public Map<String,String> getInternalState()
Called when the plugin needs to save the circuits state to disk or when using /rcinfo. The circuit should return a map containing any data needed to bring the circuit back to its current state after a server restart.

Returns:
Map containing state data.

save

public void save()
Called whenever the plugin is requested to save its data.

setInternalState

public void setInternalState(Map<String,String> state)
Called when the plugin loads a circuit from file.

Parameters:
state - Map containing state data that was read from the file. The map should hold the same data that was returned by getInternalState()

getResetData

public Map<String,Object> getResetData()
Called before the plugin resets the circuit. The circuit should return a map containing any data that may not be available on a reset condition.

Returns:
Map containing reset data.

setResetData

public void setResetData(Map<String,Object> data)
Called after the plugin resets the circuit.

Parameters:
reset - Map containing reset data to be restored. The map should hold the same data that was returned by setResetData()

circuitDestroyed

public void circuitDestroyed()
Called when the circuit is physically destroyed. Put here any necessary cleanups.

circuitShutdown

protected void circuitShutdown()
Called when the circuit is shutdown. Typically when the server shutsdown or the plugin is disabled and before a circuit is destroyed.

sendOutput

protected void sendOutput(int outIdx,
                          boolean state)
Sets the physical state of one of the outputs.

Parameters:
outIdx - Output index. First output is 0.
state - The new state of the output.

sendInt

protected void sendInt(int startOutIdx,
                       int length,
                       int value)
Send an integer through a set of outputs. First converts to BitSet by calling intToBitSet(), then calls sendBitSet().

Parameters:
startOutIdx - output index of first output (LSB).
length - number of bits/outputs to write to.
value - The integer value to send out.

sendBitSet

protected void sendBitSet(int startOutIdx,
                          int length,
                          BitSet7 bits)
Sends a BitSet object to the circuit outputs.

Parameters:
startOutIdx - First output pin that will be set.
length - Number of bits to set.
bits - The BitSet object to send out. Any excessive bits in the BitSet are ignored.

sendBitSet

protected void sendBitSet(BitSet7 bits)
Sends a BitSet object to the circuit outputs. Sends a bit to each circuit output, starting from output 0.

Parameters:
bits - BitSet object to send out.

error

public void error(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                  String message)
Useful method for posting error messages. Sends an error message to the requested command sender using the error chat color as set in the preferences file. If sender is null the message is sent to the console logger as a warning.

Parameters:
sender - The command sender to send the message to.
message - The error message.

info

public void info(org.bukkit.command.CommandSender sender,
                 String message)
Useful method for posting info messages. Sends an info message to the requested command sender using the info chat color as set in the preferences file. If sender is null the message is simply ignored.

Parameters:
sender - The CommandSender to send the message to.
message - The error message.

debug

public void debug(String message)
Sends a debug message to all debugging players of this circuit, using the debug chat color preferences key. Please check that hasDebuggers() returns true before processing any debug messages.

Parameters:
message - The error message.

addListener

public void addListener(CircuitListener l)
Adds a circuit listener.

Parameters:
d - The listener.

removeListener

public boolean removeListener(CircuitListener l)
Removes a circuit listener.

Parameters:
l - The listener.
Returns:
true if the listener was found.

getListeners

public List<CircuitListener> getListeners()
Returns:
The circuit listeners list.

hasListeners

public boolean hasListeners()
Checks if the circuit has any listeners. This method should be used before processing any debug messages to avoid wasting cpu when no one is listening.

Returns:
True if the circuit has any listeners.

hasDebuggers

@Deprecated
public boolean hasDebuggers()
Deprecated. 

getOutputBits

public BitSet7 getOutputBits()
Returns:
a clone of the outputBits field.

getInputBits

public BitSet7 getInputBits()
Returns:
a clone of the inputBits field.

getCircuitClass

public String getCircuitClass()
Returns:
The name of this circuit class, as it should be typed on the chip sign.

getChipString

public String getChipString()
Returns:
The name of the circuit class and chip id and name.

getOutputBlock

protected org.bukkit.block.Block getOutputBlock(int outputIdx)
Parameters:
outputIdx - The required output pin number.
Returns:
The output block (gold block by default) of the specific output index.

getInputBlock

protected org.bukkit.block.Block getInputBlock(int inputIdx)
Parameters:
inputIdx - The required input pin number.
Returns:
The input block (iron block by default) of the specific input index.

circuitChunkLoaded

public void circuitChunkLoaded()
Called when any of the circuit's chunks has loaded. Causes the circuit to update the state of its output levers according to the current values in outputBits.

updateInputBits

public void updateInputBits()
Update the inputBits BitSet according to the current input pin values.

isStateless

protected boolean isStateless()
Returns true. A stateless circuit is a circuit that will always output the same values for a set of input values. A logical gate is an example of a stateless circuit while a counter is not stateless.

Returns:
True if the circuit is stateless.

setDisabled

public void setDisabled(Boolean d)
Disables or enables the chip according to the parameter.

Parameters:
d - true to disable or false to enable.

disable

public void disable()
Forces the circuit to stop processing input changes.

enable

public void enable()
Enables the chip, allowing it to process input changes.

isDisabled

public boolean isDisabled()
Returns:
true if the circuit's inputs are disabled.

fixIOBlocks

public int fixIOBlocks()
Replaces the chip input, output and interface block materials to the currently set materials in the preferences.

Returns:
The number of blocks that were replaced.

updateCircuitSign

public void updateCircuitSign(boolean activated)
Updates the text and color of the 1st line of the circuit activation sign.

Parameters:
activated - When true the class name is colored in the selected signColor preference key. When false the color is removed.

checkIntegrity

public boolean checkIntegrity()
Checks whether all of the circuit's blocks are in place. Makes sure that each output lever block of lever material, checks that the activation sign is in place and that none of the circuit's structure blocks are air.

Returns:
True if the test passed.

resetOutputs

public void resetOutputs()
Turns off all outputs.

getPlugin

public RedstoneChips getPlugin()
Returns:
an instance of the RedstoneChips plugin.

setOutputBits

public void setOutputBits(BitSet7 bits)
Initializes the output buffer. Can only be used before calling initCircuit().

Parameters:
bits -
